item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Full fathom five thy father lies; Of his bones are coral made; Those are pearls that were his eyes: Nothing of him that doth fade, But doth suffer a sea-change Into something rich and strange. Sea-nymphs hourly ring his knell: Ding-dong Hark! now I hear them,—Ding-dong, bell." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "And this our life, exempt from public haunt, finds tongues in trees, books in the running brooks, sermons in stones, and good in everything. I would not change it." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "I don't know if God exists, but it would be better for His reputation if He didn't." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I felt after I finished Slaughterhouse-Five that I didn’t have to write at all anymore if I didn’t want to. It was the end of some sort of career. I don’t know why, exactly. I suppose that flowers, when they’re through blooming, have some sort of awareness of some purpose having been served. Flowers didn’t ask to be flowers and I didn’t ask to be me. At the end of Slaughterhouse-Five…I had a shutting-off feeling…that I had done what I was supposed to do and everything was OK ." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If Christ were here there is one thing he would not be—a Christian." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Robert Lowell
item.description: "The light at the end of the tunnel is just the light of an oncoming train." -- Robert Lowell
